com.yworks.yfiles.view.input

Class DropInputMode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yworks.yfiles.view.input.DropInputMode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IInputMode
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ItemDropInputMode

    public class DropInputMode
extends Object
implements IInputMode
    This is an input mode handling drag and drop related events on a CanvasControl.

    An instance of DropInputMode is initialized for an expected data format in the constructor. There are four events raised by an instance of this class.

    • DragEntered is raised, if a drag operation enters the CanvasControl.
    • DragOver is raised, if a drag operation moves over the CanvasControl after having entered it.
    • DragDropped is raised, if a drag is dropped onto the CanvasControl.
    • DragLeft is raised, if a drag is operation leaves the CanvasControl.

    Clients can query the current MousePosition which is updated while a drag is in progress. Clients get the data from the drag operation by calling DropData from an event handler registered for any of these events.

    This mode is Exclusive by default.

      • DATA_FORMAT_DROP_ID

        public static final DataFormat DATA_FORMAT_DROP_ID

    • Constructor Detail

      • DropInputMode

        public DropInputMode(Class expectedType)
        Constructs a new instance of class DropInputMode for the expected type of data.

        The input mode fires events (see DragEntered and DragDropped) only if a drag operation carries data conforming to the given type.

        Parameters:
        expectedType - This is a type which can be given to DragDropData#getData(Class).

    • Method Detail

      • addDragDroppedListener

        public final void addDragDroppedListener(IEventHandler<InputModeEventArgs> dragDroppedEvent)
        Adds the given listener for the DragDropped event that occurs when a drag operation is dropped onto the CanvasControl into which this instance is installed.

        No event is raised

        • if this instance is not Enabled,
        • if another concurrent input mode is active or
        • the data from the drag operation does not conform to the expected format.

        To get additional data for the event, clients should use the sender which is set to the sending DropInputMode. The IEventArgs provide no useful data.

        Parameters:
        dragDroppedEvent - The listener to add.
        See Also:
        removeDragDroppedListener(IEventHandler)

      • addDragEnteredListener

        public final void addDragEnteredListener(IEventHandler<InputModeEventArgs> dragEnteredEvent)

        No event is raised

        • if this instance is not Enabled,
        • if another concurrent input mode is active or
        • the data from the drag operation does not conform to the expected format.

        To get additional data for the event, clients should use the sender which is set to the sending DropInputMode. The IEventArgs provide no useful data.

        Parameters:
        dragEnteredEvent - The listener to add.
        See Also:
        removeDragEnteredListener(IEventHandler)

      • getDropData

        public Object getDropData()
        Gets the data carried by a drag operation.

        This is only valid, if a drag entered the CanvasControl first.

        Returns:
        The DropData.

      • getDropData

        protected Object getDropData(Dragboard dragboard)
        Gets the data carried by the drag operation. This method is called by getDropData() with the current Dragboard as argument. The dragboard is set after a DragEvent.DRAG_ENTERED event on the CanvasControl occurs and updated for a DragEvent.DRAG_DROPPED event that follows if an transfermode is set.
        Parameters:
        dragboard - the dragboard that may contain the object that represents the drop data. This argument may be null.
        Returns:
        the data carried by the drag operation associated with the given drag board.

      • getDropDataMap

        public Map getDropDataMap()
        Returns the map that maps a drop id to in instance of the type this DropInputMode was created for.

      • getDropLocation

        public final PointD getDropLocation()
        Gets the mouse position after dropping an item.

        The position is returned in world coordinates according to the CanvasControl into which this input mode is installed.

        Returns:
        The DropLocation.

      • getExpectedType

        protected final Class getExpectedType()
        Returns the type of data this DropInputMode instance can handle.

      • getInputModeContext

        public final IInputModeContext getInputModeContext()
        Description copied from interface: IInputMode
        Returns the context instance this mode is currently installed in or null if this instance is not installed.

        Note that this instance should not be passed down to subordinate modes or instances. Instead a corresponding context that has this instance set as the ParentInputMode should be used.

        Specified by:
        getInputModeContext in interface IInputMode
        Returns:
        The InputModeContext.

      • getLastDragEvent

        public final DragEvent getLastDragEvent()
        Gets the last processed drag event argument.
        Returns:
        The LastDragEventArgs.

      • getMousePosition

        public final IPoint getMousePosition()
        Gets the current mouse position during drag operations.

        The position is returned in world coordinates according to the CanvasControl into which this input mode is installed.

        Returns:
        The MousePosition.

      • getPriority

        public final int getPriority()
        Description copied from interface: IInputMode
        The priority of this input mode.

        The priority will influence the order in which the modes will be installed into the canvas control. The lower the priority value, the earlier it will be installed. If two modes are installed using the same priority value, the first one will be installed earlier.

        Specified by:
        getPriority in interface IInputMode
        Returns:
        The Priority.

        public final TransferMode[] getTransferMode()
        Gets the TransferMode that will be used for drags on the canvas.
        Returns:
        The TransferMode.
        See Also:
        setTransferMode(javafx.scene.input.TransferMode...)

      • getValidDropHitTestable

        public final IHitTestable getValidDropHitTestable()
        Gets the IHitTestable that determines whether the given location is a valid drop location.
        Returns:
        The hit testable that yields true for valid drop locations.
        See Also:
        setValidDropHitTestable(IHitTestable)

      • install

        public void install(IInputModeContext context,
                    ConcurrencyController controller)
        Installs this mode into the given canvas.

        Clients should not call this method as this is handled by the framework.

        Specified by:
        install in interface IInputMode
        Parameters:
        context - the context to install this mode into
        controller - The Controller for this mode.
        See Also:
        CanvasControl

      • isCapturingMouseInputDuringDragEnabled

        public final boolean isCapturingMouseInputDuringDragEnabled()
        Gets a value indicating whether to capture mouse input during drag operations.

        The default is true and thus prevents mouse events from being processed by visuals in the canvas.

        Returns:
        true if mouse input should be captured during the drag; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setCapturingMouseInputDuringDragEnabled(boolean)

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Gets the enabled state of this input mode.

        Clients can use this property to disable or reenable this instance. This will set the Enabled property of the installed Controller so a disabled instance should never try to acquire the input mutex.

        Returns:
        The Enabled.
        See Also:
        setEnabled(boolean)

      • isExclusive

        public final boolean isExclusive()
        Gets a value indicating whether this mode will be the only one running when it has the mutex.

        The value of this property will be delegated to the Exclusive property of the Controller.

        If this mode is marked as exclusive and has the mutex, all other modes added to the same MultiplexingInputMode will be deactivated. Otherwise it will always run concurrently with all other modes.

        Returns:
        The Exclusive.
        See Also:
        setExclusive(boolean)

      • onCanceled

        protected void onCanceled()
        Called after cancel() has been called.

        Can be overridden in subclasses to perform additional actions after the mode has been canceled.

        This implementation does nothing.

      • onConcurrencyControllerActivated

        protected void onConcurrencyControllerActivated()
        Called after the Active property of the installed ConcurrencyController has been set to true.

        Can be overridden in subclasses to perform additional actions after the mode has been activated.

        Overriding implementations should call the base implementation.

      • onConcurrencyControllerDeactivated

        protected void onConcurrencyControllerDeactivated()
        Called after the Active property of the installed ConcurrencyController has been set to false.

        Can be overridden in subclasses to perform additional actions after the mode has been deactivated.

        Overriding implementations should call the base implementation.

        Called once a drag has left the canvas.

      • onDraggedOver

        protected void onDraggedOver(InputModeEventArgs eventArgs)
        Called whenever a drag is over the canvas.

      • onStopped

        protected void onStopped()
        Called after stop() has been called.

        Can be overridden in subclasses to perform additional actions after the mode has been stopped.

        This implementation does nothing.

      • removeDragDroppedListener

        public final void removeDragDroppedListener(IEventHandler<InputModeEventArgs> dragDroppedEvent)
        Removes the given listener for the DragDropped event that occurs when a drag operation is dropped onto the CanvasControl into which this instance is installed.

        No event is raised

        • if this instance is not Enabled,
        • if another concurrent input mode is active or
        • the data from the drag operation does not conform to the expected format.

        To get additional data for the event, clients should use the sender which is set to the sending DropInputMode. The IEventArgs provide no useful data.

        Parameters:
        dragDroppedEvent - The listener to remove.
        See Also:
        addDragDroppedListener(IEventHandler)

      • setCapturingMouseInputDuringDragEnabled

        public final void setCapturingMouseInputDuringDragEnabled(boolean value)
        Sets a value indicating whether to capture mouse input during drag operations.

        The default is true and thus prevents mouse events from being processed by visuals in the canvas.

        Parameters:
        value - true if mouse input should be captured during the drag; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isCapturingMouseInputDuringDragEnabled()

      • setDragLocation

        protected void setDragLocation(PointD location)
        This method updates the MousePosition according to the coordinates passed in.

        It is called prior to the onDragEntered(InputModeEventArgs), onDraggedOver(InputModeEventArgs), onDragDropped(InputModeEventArgs) and onDragExited(InputModeEventArgs) methods.

        Parameters:
        location - The current location of the mouse in world coordinates.

      • setDropDataMap

        public void setDropDataMap(Map dropDataMap)
        Sets the map that maps a drop id to in instance of the type this DropInputMode was created for.
        Parameters:
        dropDataMap - The mapping between drop ids and drop data instances.

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean value)
        Sets the enabled state of this input mode.

        Clients can use this property to disable or reenable this instance. This will set the Enabled property of the installed Controller so a disabled instance should never try to acquire the input mutex.

        Parameters:
        value - The Enabled to set.
        See Also:
        isEnabled()

      • setExclusive

        public final void setExclusive(boolean value)
        Sets a value indicating whether this mode will be the only one running when it has the mutex.

        The value of this property will be delegated to the Exclusive property of the Controller.

        If this mode is marked as exclusive and has the mutex, all other modes added to the same MultiplexingInputMode will be deactivated. Otherwise it will always run concurrently with all other modes.

        Parameters:
        value - The Exclusive to set.
        See Also:
        isExclusive()

      • setPriority

        public final void setPriority(int value)
        The priority of this input mode.

        The priority will influence the order in which the modes will be installed into the canvas control. The lower the priority value, the earlier it will be installed. If two modes are installed using the same priority value, the first one will be installed earlier.

        Parameters:
        value - The Priority to set.
        See Also:
        getPriority()
